title: Self service
developerResponse:
{'id': 37208209, 'body': "Hi there ,
Here's how to change the phone number on your Kuda Account1. Go to selfhelp.kuda.com
2. Select Update my phone number
3. Sign in using your Email and Password
4. Enter the New Phone Number you like to add.
5. Enter the code sent to your new number.
6. Enter your 4-digit transaction pin
7. Select Continue to Verify your identity with a selfie video
8. Select Start, to Take a selfie video and make 2-3 circles with your face.
9. Select the Red button at the center to Stop
10. Select Done once completed. We'll send you a mail once your New Phone Number has been updated,
Thank youüíú", 'modified': '2023-06-19T13:52:41Z'}

title: Stamp
developerResponse:
{'id': 35050864, 'body': 'In line with the Federal Government‚Äôs Stamp Duty Act, we‚Äôre required by law to apply a 50 naira charge to all deposits of 10,000 naira or more made into your Kuda account. This charge will apply to the following kinds of deposits:
Electronic transfers
Money added to your account with a debit card.
Cash deposits made into your account at any of our partner banks.
Does Kuda gain anything from this charge?
No, we don‚Äôt gain anything from the charge. All financial institutions have been directed by the Federal Government to apply the charge, and we remit the entire charge to the government.
We‚Äôll continue to do our best to give you free financial services that you can rely on, including covering the cost of your first 25 transfers every month.
', 'modified': '2023-02-24T08:58:57Z'}

review: Please add data subscription to Kuda bank
title: Data subscription
developerResponse:
{'id': 35251208, 'body': "Hi There ,
Thank you for reaching out .
Here's how you can purchase internet data on your app:
Login to your Kuda app
Tap Payments at the bottom of your dashboard.
Tap Pay a bill.
Choose Internet.
Choose the Service Provider, and type in the Customer ID number and the amount.
Tap Next
Confirm your purchase with your transaction PIN, Face ID, or fingerprint.
Thank you.üíú


", 'modified': '2023-03-07T11:08:46Z'}

review: It‚Äôs sad to know you guys take 50 naira for money received above 10,000 and will still deduct 10 naira everytime I send money to other banks. Your customer care is the poorest only God knows what mobile bank someone can rely on. The excessive charges will kill us someday
title: Excessive charges
developerResponse:
{'id': 33324400, 'body': 'Hi there ,
Thank you for reaching out .
Please inline with the FGN Stamp Duty Act, we‚Äôre required by law to apply a 50 naira charge to all deposits of 10,000 naira or more made into your Kuda account
we don‚Äôt gain anything from the charge.All financial institutions have been directed by the Federal Government to apply the charge,and we remit the entire charge to the government . 



Kuda Bank provides their customers with 25 free transfers to any Nigerian bank per month . After those 25 transfers, you will be charged 10 naira each. Your free transfer limit resets each month.
Thank you .üíú
', 'modified': '2022-11-23T09:50:01Z'}

review: I‚Äôm not happy with your bank,formerly it was a bank with no charges but now any electronic transfer been made a service charge of #50 is been taken calculate that everyday till month end it‚Äôs worse than other banks
title: Stamp duty charge
developerResponse:
{'id': 31301496, 'body': "Hi Agba.
I'm sorry for the inconvenience this may have caused you.
In line with the Federal Government‚Äôs Stamp Duty Act, we‚Äôre required by law to apply a 50 naira charge to all deposits of 10,000 naira or more made into your Kuda account.
This charge will apply to the following kinds of deposits:
- Electronic transfers
- Money added to your account with a debit card.
- Cash deposits made into your account at any of our partner banks.
Does Kuda gain anything from this charge?
No, we don‚Äôt gain anything from the charge. All financial institutions have been directed by the Federal Government to apply the charge, and we remit the entire charge to the government.
We‚Äôll continue to do our best to give you free financial services that you can rely on, including covering the cost of your first 25 transfers every month.
Thank you.", 'modified': '2022-08-05T14:58:17Z'}

review: They need to get branches around, at least 1 in every state where people can lay their complaints, not everyone is good in typing or  sending mails‚Ä¶ this is very important and I urge Kuda to take this serious
title: Nice App
developerResponse:
{'id': 33362369, 'body': "Hi there ,
Thanks for reaching out. 
We don‚Äôt have branches (because you don‚Äôt need branches). Kuda runs entirely on your phone (with an internet connection) and we‚Äôll deliver your debit card to any address in Nigeria. We believe that we can give you useful, friendly, fast service without branches. 
Because we don‚Äôt have branches, we save a lot of money. That‚Äôs how we can afford to pay you more interest than most banks and charge so little..
Branches allow banks to do certain things, however. Cash deposits are one of them. At Kuda, we've found a way around this by partnering with the biggest banks in Nigeria. To make a cash deposit:
Open Kuda.
Tap Add Money on your dashboard.
Tap Add By Deposit then tap the partner bank you prefer.
Follow the instructions to deposit cash into your Kuda account at a bank branch.
If you really need to visit us, our office is on the First Floor, 11, Commercial Avenue, Sabo, Yaba, Lagos. Visits are by appointment only, please
Thank you üíú", 'modified': '2022-11-25T08:46:35Z'}
